text:
I came across a GSOC proposal from another student for parallel lightgraph algorithms <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NXGckglOR2uRjbE6VPrDj6_a8zvQmh7b74HLvzCMX8Y/edit>
I wonder why it got rejected? Is it the priority of the topic or the quality of the proposal? I'm thinking of picking up a project like this if there's a need for it

elements.text: I came across a GSOC proposal from another student for parallel lightgraph algorithms
I wonder why it got rejected? Is it the priority of the topic or the quality of the proposal? I'm thinking of picking up a project like this if there's a need for it

text:
I can't say anything specific about that proposal, as I was not involved in the process in 2020, but what you should know is, that we only get a limited number of GSOC places each year - that year it was enough for any graph topic, but we had the capacity for one student to do JSOC instead.

That other proposal that was accepted was also on parallel lightgraph algorithms
